title: Legal and Economic Aspects of Sovereign Debt Default: The Argentina Case
abstractText:
Recent Latin American debt problems have forced investors to face the questions:

Once a country defaults on sovereign debt,

  1. What options are open to its creditors to recover their capital?
  2. What are the future repayment incentives of the defaulting country given that it has lost reputation, ie should they lend again to a defaulting country?

In this project we propose to examine these two questions. We will focus (a) on the outcomes of the debt restructuring bargaining and analyse the impact of third parties, creditor heterogeneity and the legal structure of sovereign bonds on these outcomes; and (b) we question whether reputation can be an important way to prevent sovereign debt default. For this question we will analyse the efficacy of punishment strategies of the creditors.
